definition: thick paste of fermented soybean/marinated in soy paste/paste/jam

sentences.english: Heat oil. Add Chng Kee's Sambal Belacan Chilli Paste and stir-fry until fragrant.
sentences.chinese: 用熱油翻炒莊記參芭芭拉煎辣椒醬至香味溢出。

sentences.english: Kate made pasta and roasted red pepper sauce for supper.
sentences.chinese: 凱特爲晚飯做了意式面及烤紅辣椒醬。

sentences.english: In another shallow bowl, whisk the eggs, buttermilk and hot pepper sauce.
sentences.chinese: 在另一淺碗中，打散蛋，混合牛奶與辣椒醬。

sentences.english: Chilli sauce can titillate our palates.
sentences.chinese: 辣椒醬可以挑逗我們的味覺。

sentences.english: You can get poutine with chili sauce or even spaghetti meat sauce.
sentences.chinese: 你可以要份布丁配辣椒醬甚至是肉醬意大利細麪條。

sentences.english: B : Mayishangshu is vermicelli cooked with mince pork in chili sauce.
sentences.chinese: 螞蟻上樹是用粉條和豬肉末以及辣椒醬做的。

sentences.english: Would you like some chili sauce on the side of your plate?
sentences.chinese: 休要在盤子旁邊放一些辣椒醬嗎？

sentences.english: Chilli sauce can titillate our palates.
People in the north and southwest like to dress their dish with chilli oil or chilli paste.
sentences.chinese: 北方人和西南地區的人們愛在菜上澆辣椒油或辣椒醬。

sentences.english: Put some hot sauce on the side, please.
I pour as much hot sauce into pho, it's the only way to have pho.
sentences.chinese: 我倒了好多的辣椒醬，這是喫越南面的唯一方法。

sentences.english: According to a report Thursday by the Korea Associated Press, Seoul will introduce the industry standardfor measuring the hotness of chili sauces later this month.
sentences.chinese: 據報道，韓國將從4月底起引進辣椒醬辣味分級標準。

definition: thick paste of fermented soybean/marinated in soy paste/paste/jam
